Class MazeCode

  • java.lang.Object
    • MazeCode

  • public class MazeCode
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that holds a 2D String Array that serves as the initial maze for the program to solve. An object from the test class will call on the 'start()' method which drives the code in the class. Methods will be called to getting maze traversal starting point and then work to solve the maze. The user will be prompted to enter a keyboard input each time the maze position is updated so that they will be able to see the maze visibly being solved. If the maze can be solved, the final path from start to finish will be printed to the console, otherwise a message will be printed that that maze is not solvable.
    Author:
    armondluthens

      • startingPosition

        private static int[] startingPosition()
        Method to determine the starting postion coordinates of the initial maze (2D Array)
        Returns:
        an integer array with the starting row position in the 0th index and the starting column position in the 1st index

      • traverseMaze

        private static boolean traverseMaze(java.lang.String[][] maze,
                   int currentRow,
                   int currentColumn)
        Method that uses recursion to constantly traverse through the maze and check if a move is valid. Will first attempt to make a valid move through paths that have not been yet traversed, and then will backtrack if a deadend is encountered.
        Parameters:
        maze - 2D maze array that is updated with each call to the function
        currentRow -
        currentColumn -
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating if the maze is solvable or not

      • printFinalPath

        Method to print only the correct path from start to finish once the maze has been deemed possible to solve.
        Parameters:
        maze - 2D maze array that is updated with each call to the function
